meanings.definition: Discontinue a session of (a parliament or other legislative assembly) without dissolving it.
meanings.sent1: The Prime Minister decided to prorogue the parliament until further notice.
meanings.sent2: The Speaker of the House prorogued the assembly after a long day of debates.
meanings.sent3: The members of the parliament were surprised when the Speaker suddenly prorogued the session to go for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The decision to prorogue the meeting left many unresolved issues hanging in the air.
meanings.sent5: The act of proroguing the parliament was met with mixed reactions from the public.

meanings.sent1: Due to bad weather, they had to prorogue the outdoor event to the following weekend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to prorogue the exam to allow more time for students to prepare.
meanings.sent3: The team captain had to prorogue the match due to an unexpected player injury.
meanings.sent4: The decision to prorogue the project deadline caused some delays in the overall schedule.
meanings.sent5: They had to prorogue the meeting to next week due to conflicting schedules.
